title: Passan predicts MLB megadeals: Who will be next to get $100 million? $300 million? $600 million?!
content: These players are due to get paid -- from who will join the nine-figure club to who could break Juan Soto's record.

title: Browns' Sanders to wear 12, like mentor Brady
content: The Browns on Tuesday announced jersey numbers for their rookies, and Shedeur Sanders will wear No. 12, as the No. 2 he wore in high school and college was selected by veteran DeAndre Carter.

title: Gators, Golden agree to 6-year, $40.5M extension
content: Florida coach Todd Golden, fresh off a national title, has agreed to a six-year, $40.5 million contract extension through the 2030-31 season.

title: 'I knew it wasn't a miss': Gordon's 3 stuns OKC
content: For the second time in these playoffs, Aaron Gordon delivered the winning shot after Denver rallied from a double-digit deficit to stun the Thunder at home in Game 1 of their Western Conference semifinal series.

title: Williams wilts again, sees ERA top 10 as Yankee
content: New York reliever Devin Williams' nightmare season continued on Monday night with another poor outing in the Yankees' 4-3 loss to the San Diego Padres, as the right-hander was charged with three runs, increasing his ERA to 10.03 in 14 games this season.

title: Clemson, ND to announce 12-year schedule deal
content: Clemson and Notre Dame are set to announce a 12-year scheduling agreement that will pit the two college football powers against each other annually through 2038.

title: Panthers' Bennett: No 'ill intent' toward Stolarz
content: Panthers forward Sam Bennett denied any "ill intent" after he elbowed Maple Leafs' goaltender Anthony Stolarz in the head during Game 1 of their second-round Eastern Conference playoff series on Monday.

title: Celts 'bit off' as shooting woes reach historic level
content: The Celtics might've finally reached a saturation point as they missed a record 45 3-pointers Monday night as the Knicks took advantage in a 108-105 Game 1 overtime victory.

title: Ravens make 'tough decision,' cut kicker Tucker
content: The Ravens on Monday released kicker Justin Tucker, parting ways with the NFL's most accurate kicker who is being investigated by the league for sexual misconduct.

title: üìàNFL Power Rankings: Re-shuffling after the draft
content: Our panel of experts ranked every NFL team from 1 to 32. Which franchises improved with their draft picks and offseason moves?

title: 'Job well done': Inside Gregg Popovich's unparalleled NBA legacy
content: Friends, colleagues, players and confidantes all agree: Popovich has impacted more people across the game than perhaps anyone in history.

title: NFL experts debate the draft: Which teams have the most impactful rookie classes?
content: Could the Patriots' rookies make an immediate impact? Experts weigh in with their favorite classes and picks.

title: Lessons of the Stanley Cup playoffs: Will the high scoring continue? Ewing Theory in Dallas, Winnipeg?
content: With the opening round in the books, here are the top takeaways that will influence the rest of the playoffs.

title: The six X factors that will determine the second round
content: From players to coaching tactics to pace of play, these are six key factors that will be critical in the second round.

title: Joe Burrow, Simone Biles shine on the 2025 Met Gala's red carpet
content: Sabrina Ionescu, Breanna Stewart, Joe Burrow, Jonathan Owens and Saquon Barkley make their debuts at the 2025 Met Gala.

title: Everything to know about Monday's NBA draft lottery, from picks to what we're hearing
content: Draft experts Jonathan Givony and Jeremy Woo break down the odds, likely picks and best fits for prospects.

title: The worst good players: Which elite stars stink at passing? Who can't dribble or shoot?
content: Among the top Champions League players, who stinks at passing? Who can't run? Who shouldn't dribble? Here are the worst good players.

title: PSG get boost as Demb√©l√© passed fit vs. Arsenal
content: Paris Saint-Germain received a boost ahead of Wednesday's Champions League semifinal second leg against Arsenal with Ousmane Demb√©l√© passed fit.

title: Minister sorry to Liverpool fans over UCL final
content: France's former interior minister Gerald Darmanin has apologised to Liverpool fans for wrongly blaming them for the chaos before the 2022 Champions League final in Paris.

title: Source: Man Utd to resist any offers for Fernandes
content: A source has told ESPN that Bruno Fernandes is one of the few players whose future is seen as secure at Man United despite a battle to balance the club's books.

title: Sources: Madrid want Alexander-Arnold for CWC
content: Real Madrid want Trent Alexander-Arnold to join them for this summer's Club World Cup, sources have told ESPN, and now plan talks with Liverpool to negotiate his early release.

title: Raphinha on Bar√ßa revival: Xavi never rated me
content: Barcelona forward Raphinha has revealed his anger at the lack of football he played under Xavi Hern√°ndez, saying he feels his former coach never showed any real confidence in him.

title: Brazil want to decide new coach next week - chief
content: The Brazil Football Confederation (CBF) expect to name the men's national team coach by the end of next week "at the latest."

title: Paquet√° in a 'nightmare' amid betting case - wife
content: West Ham United midfielder Lucas Paquet√°'s wife has said their family have been "living a nightmare for two years" after being involved in an investigation over match fixing.

title: Kane targets trophy 'number two' after title win
content: England striker Harry Kane said it feels sweet to finally end his career-long trophy drought after securing the Bundesliga title with Bayern Munich

title: Who will kick for Ravens after Justin Tucker release? A look at his likely successor
content: After drafting the Arizona kicker in the sixth round, the team will likely turn to Tyler Loop after releasing Tucker on Monday.

title: Risers and new entrants to our latest top 25
content: UConn climbs the ranks. Illinois and Creighton join the mix. See the fourth edition of our early top 25.

title: Our final college softball rankings of the 2025 regular season: Top 25 poll and what to watch
content: Check out the final college softball Top 25 poll of the 2025 regular season, plus play and player of the week.

title: West Virginia football unveils throwback uniforms that pay homage to 1965 team
content: The threads, unveiled Monday, will feature tweaks to the team's usual color scheme and a modern version of the helmets worn by the 1965 squad.

title: Grading MLB's City Connect uniforms: Snakes launch best look of 2025
content: From the pastel Padres to the Motor City Tigers and beyond, we break down MLB's City Connect uniforms.

title: An inside look at the day boxing took over New York's Times Square
content: How one of the most iconic places in New York City transformed from a tourist area to a boxing venue.

title: MMA divisional rankings: After win, did Cory Sandhagen even budge at bantamweight?
content: Here's a look at every weight class to determine the best of the best in UFC, Bellator, PFL and beyond.

title: Stanley Cup playoff odds: Panthers, Stars are favorites to hoist Cup
content: Every playoff team's odds to win the 2025 Stanley Cup and favorites for the Conn Smythe Trophy for playoff MVP.

title: Stock watch: Shelby Miller for saves?
content: Everything fantasy baseball managers need to know about which closers should be added, dropped, and more.

title: All eyes on WNBA, but Unrivaled looks to build on momentum for next season
content: After a successful inaugural season, Unrivaled's stakeholders must figure out how to build on the momentum.

title: Bellingham ruled last season's Cl√°sicos. Can he save Madrid's title hopes vs. Bar√ßa?
content: It's been a challenging second season for Jude Bellingham at Real Madrid, but Sunday's title-deciding Cl√°sico is the perfect stage for him to step up.

title: Michele Kang is spending millions to scoop up women's soccer teams around the world. What's her plan?
content: Billionaire club owner Michele Kang speaks to ESPN about her new vision for women's soccer and the money she's pouring in to make it a reality.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United open talks with Osimhen
content: Initial talks have taken place between Manchester United and the representatives of on-loan Galatasaray striker Victor Osimhen. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Kirst, Kavanagh or English? Paul Carcaterra's big board for the 2025 PLL draft
content: ESPN's Paul Carcaterra ranks the 2025 PLL draft's top prospects and matches teams up with players who best fit their needs.

title: "India's Water Will Be Used For India's Interests": PM Modi's Message To Pak
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has made it clear that the decision to put a freeze on the Indus water treaty that stopped the supply to Pakistan, will not be reversed, saying "India's water will be used for India's interests".

title: Moong Dal Halwa, Rice For Indian Astronaut's Travel To Space Station
content: Indian Air Force (IAF) Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla will carry moong dal halwa, Indian rice and Mango nectar among other Indian delicacies, when he flies to the International Space Station (ISS) next month, becoming the first Indian to do so.

title: Why Distributors Are Planning To Suspend Colgate Products' Purchase
content: Distributors of Colgate Palmolive have decided to suspend purchase of all its products in Maharastra from May 12 alleging that the company was offering deep discounts to quick-commerce channels, which is against the interest of general trade.

title: Pakistani Man Arrested Along LoC In J&K's Poonch
content: A 26-year-old Pakistani intruder was arrested along the Line of Control in Jammu and Kashmir's Poonch district on Tuesday, officials said.

title: As India, UK Clinch Landmark Trade Deal, A Look At The Gains And Hurdles
content: India and the United Kingdom have clinched a landmark free trade agreement. This marks UK's most significant post-Brexit deal and India's first outside of Asia and Australia.

title: ISRO's Ambitious 'Gaganyaan' Mission With Indian Crew To Lift Off In 2027
content: India's first human spaceflight from Sriharikota will lift off in 2027. There have been repeated pushbacks on the human space flight, but the technology is complex, and India is mastering it on its own. No country shares this critical technology.

title: Friedrich Merz Elected German Chancellor After Initial Shock Defeat
content: German conservative leader Friedrich Merz was elected chancellor by parliament on Tuesday in a second round of voting after his new alliance with the centre-left Social Democrats was dealt a surprise defeat in the first attempt.

title: India-Pak Tension Live Updates: IAF To Hold Major Drill Along Pakistan Border Tomorrow, Flight Services To Be Hit
content: India Pakistan Tensions LIVE Updates: The Indian Air Force (IAF) will carry out a mega military exercise in Rajasthan, along the International Border with Pakistan, on Wednesday.

title: High Court's "Enemy Country" Reference To Slam Punjab-Haryana Water Dispute
content: The raging water dispute between Punjab and Haryana has irked the High Court, which pointed out today that while India has decided to take measures against Pakistan, states within the country "should not be doing the same against each other".

title: 7 Pakistani Soldiers Killed In Bomb Explosion In Balochistan
content: Seven Pakistani paramilitary troops were killed and five others wounded on Tuesday in a homemade bomb attack on a convoy in southwestern Balochistan province, officials said.

title: Adani Foundation Chairperson Priti Adani Receives A Second Doctorate
content: Adani Foundation Chairperson Priti Adani was today conferred with Doctor of Science (D.Sc.) Honoris Causa by Datta Meghe Institute of Higher Education & Research (Deemed to be University), Wardha, Maharashtra.

title: Woman Dies By Suicide At Noida's Golf Course Metro Station
content: A 25-year-old woman died after she allegedly jumped in front of a moving train at the Golf Course Metro Station on Tuesday noon.

title: "Gaurav Gogoi Spent 15 Days In Pak": Himanta Sarma's Big Allegation
content: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma took his allegations against Congress MP Gaurav Gogoi a step further today, making some very serious allegations against the Deputy Leader of the Opposition in the Lok Sabha.

title: India, UK Sign Trade Pact, PM Modi Says It Will Deepen Strategic Partnership
content: India and the UK have signed the long-awaited Free Trade Agreement, Prime Minister Narendra Modi has announced.

title: Gaganyaan Mission To Be Held In First Quarter Of 2027: ISRO Chief
content: The launch of India's maiden human space flight -- Gaganyaan -- has been pushed to the first quarter of 2027, nearly five years later than the original schedule as it races to ace technologies for such complex projects.

title: 'Michelangelo Meets James Bond': The Secretive Process To Elect New Pope
content: Vatican technicians are securing what on Wednesday will arguably become the world's most beautiful bunker, making sure that what happens in the Sistine Chapel stays in the Sistine Chapel.

title: CBI Court Sentences Ex-Karnataka Minister To 7 Years Jail In Illegal Mining Case
content: A special CBI court here on Tuesday convicted former Karnataka minister and MLA Gali Janardhan Reddy and three others in the Obulapuram Mining Company (OMC) illegal mining case.

title: Rahul Gandhi Excommunicated From Hinduism For Insulting Manusmriti: Shankaracharya
content: Shankaracharya Swami Avimukteshwaranand Saraswati on Tuesday said Leader of Opposition in the Lok Sabha Rahul Gandhi has been excommunicated from Hinduism for insulting the Manusmriti.

title: "What's Left To Bomb?" Israel's Plan To Expand Gaza Offensive Brings Fear
content: Israel's plan to expand its Gaza offensive, displace people within the enclave and take control of aid distribution has horrified Gazans who have already suffered multiple displacements and food shortages during 19 months of conflict.

title: From Blackouts To Taking Shelter: How War Prep Impacts Life Of Civilians
content: The country is preparing for an unprecedented civil defence security drill tomorrow to "train civilians and students for effective civil defence in the event of a hostile attack."

title: Cheaper cars & whisky, gains for professionals: What FTA with UK means for India
content: India and the UK have finalized a Free Trade Agreement, poised to boost economic growth and trade relations. The agreement eliminates tariffs on approximately 99% of traded goods, benefiting sectors like manufacturing, textiles, and automotive. It also includes provisions for professional visas and reduced duties on products like Scotch whisky and cars, fostering job creation and deeper collaboration.

title: Pak plans to increase defence budget by 18%: How it compares with India
content: Amidst escalating tensions following the Pahalgam attack, Pakistan plans to increase its defence budget by 18%. India, a major military power, spends significantly more but faces resource allocation challenges. With China's support for Pakistan and its own growing military strength, India confronts a two-front challenge. Recent actions include ceasefire violations, mock drills, and nuclear modernization, highlighting the complex security landscape.

title: CEOs Microsoft, Adobe, IBM, Cognizant and others warn US is falling behind
content: Top CEOs, including Microsoft's Satya Nadella, are urging the U.S. to mandate computer science and AI education in K-12 schools. They warn that America is lagging behind countries like China and Singapore. The leaders emphasize that a single computer science course could boost wages by 8% and unlock significant economic potential.

title: 'Cover fire for terrorists': India envoy blasts Irish Times over J&K attack editorial
content: Indian ambassador Akhilesh Mishra strongly criticized The Irish Times for its editorial on the Pahalgam terror attack, accusing it of downplaying terrorism and echoing narratives that support its perpetrators. Mishra highlighted the editorial's failure to condemn the attack unequivocally and its criticism of PM Modi.

title: 'At behest of Pakistan': MEA rejects OIC statement on Pahalgam attack
content: India's Ministry of External Affairs has strongly refuted the Organization of Islamic Cooperation's (OIC) statement regarding the Pahalgam terror attack, labeling it "absurd and misguided." The MEA spokesperson accused Pakistan of manipulating the OIC to issue a self-serving statement, rejecting any interference in India's internal matters.

title: India squad for England tour: BCCI secretary gives a major update
content: The Indian squad for the England tour will be selected in two weeks, confirmed BCCI secretary Devajit Saikia. India A players, already in a prepared pool, are set to depart on May 25 for three four-day games before the Test series commencing June 20.

title: Warren Buffet: I am somewhat embarrassed to say Apple CEO Tim Cook ...
content: Warren Buffett, the legendary investor, acknowledged Tim Cook's role in Berkshire Hathaway's success. He credited Apple's CEO for significant financial gains. Buffett announced his retirement at the annual meeting. This marked the end of an era. Greg Abel, the vice chairman, is set to succeed Buffett. Abel will lead Berkshire with a focus on long-term value.

title: 'Gaurav Gogoi's wife continued receiving salary from Pak': Himanta
content: Assam chief minister Himanta Biswa Sarma has accused Congress MP Gaurav Gogoi and his wife of having links to Pakistan, alleging suspicious travels and activities. Sarma claims Gogoi visited Pakistan personally for 15 days, while his wife made multiple trips accompanied by Pakistani officials. Gogoi has dismissed the allegations as petty politics, accusing Sarma of involving his family.

title: Avneet Kaur spotted in stands during GT vs MI match
content: Avneet Kaur's presence at an IPL match sparked social media buzz after Virat Kohli's account seemingly liked her photo. Kohli attributed it to an algorithm error, requesting no assumptions. Singer Rahul Vaidya then mocked Kohli's explanation, suggesting similar 'glitches' could affect him and humorously claiming Kohli blocked him due to the post, possibly another 'algorithm' issue.

title: Amazon founder Jeff Bezos loses World's Second-Richest man title to...
content: Mark Zuckerberg's wealth has surged past Jeff Bezos, making him the world's second-richest person with a net worth of $212 billion, driven by Meta's strong first-quarter revenue and positive stock performance. While Zuckerberg gained $846 million on May 5, Bezos lost $2.90 billion.

title: Yemen's Sanaa airport 'completely destroyed' in Israeli strike, say officials
content: An Israeli airstrike has reportedly caused the complete destruction of Sanaa airport in Yemen, following a Houthi missile attack targeting Israel's Ben Gurion Airport. The strikes also hit power stations, causing power cuts in Sanaa and Hodeida. The Houthis have vowed to retaliate, declaring their continued support for Gaza amidst ongoing Red Sea attacks.

title: India to hold mega civil defence drill tomorrow after Pak-backed J&K attack
content: India is set to conduct a nationwide civil defence mock drill, focusing on the designated 'civil defence districts' some of which house sensitive installations. This exercise, amidst heightened tensions following a recent terror attack, aims to simulate wartime scenarios, testing air raid protocols and evacuation plans.

title: Gautam Gambhir opens up on his relationship with Virat Kohli
content: Gautam Gambhir addressed his past on-field clashes with Virat Kohli, clarifying that their bond remains strong despite representing opposing teams. He humorously dismissed rumors fueled by their IPL interactions, attributing them to TRP-driven speculation. Gambhir lauded Kohli's contributions to Indian cricket and even expressed admiration for his exceptional fitness, jokingly requesting the BCCI to limit social media posts about them.

title: What is India-UK Free Trade Agreement? Explained in 15 points
content: India and the UK have finalized a significant free trade agreement. The agreement ensures duty-free access to UK markets for 99% of Indian exports. India will reduce import duties on 90% of tariff lines, benefiting consumers with lower prices on various goods.

title: Buttery fingers! Gujarat Titans drop 3 catches inside powerplay vs Mumbai Indians
content: Gujarat Titans' decision to bowl first was marred by sloppy fielding, dropping three crucial catches in the powerplay and gifting Mumbai Indians early opportunities. Despite Mohammed Siraj's early breakthrough and Arshad Khan's tight bowling, missed chances off Will Jacks and Suryakumar Yadav proved costly. Shubman Gill noted Rabada's absence, while Hardik Pandya welcomed batting first, emphasizing execution.

title: Watch: Ashish Nehra wildly celebrates Rohit Sharma's dismissal in MI vs GT
content: Gujarat Titans' coach Ashish Nehra celebrated Rohit Sharma's dismissal by left-arm seamer Arshad Khan. This marks the third instance in the tournament where a left-arm bowler has claimed Sharma's wicket. Since IPL 2023, Sharma has been dismissed twelve times by left-arm seamers, highlighting a vulnerability. Trent Boult has dismissed Sharma six times in T20s.

title: 'Dangerous culture': Bombay HC slams police for 'copy-pasting' witness statements
content: The Bombay High Court has expressed serious concerns about police officers routinely copy-pasting witness statements into charge sheets, even in serious criminal cases, cautioning that this "dangerous culture" could benefit the accused. The court has directed the Maharashtra government to issue guidelines for recording witness statements and appointed an amicus curiae to suggest improvements to investigation quality.

title: Groom gets wedding gifts of Rs15 cr including petrol pump, 210 Bighas land
content: A viral video from an Indian wedding showcases extravagant gifts given to the groom by the bride's family, including silver, a petrol pump, and land worth INR 15.65 crore. While the video garnered significant attention, it sparked debate about the prevalence of dowry, a deeply rooted social evil in India.

title: India vs Pakistan cricket relations: Gautam Gambhir makes a big statement
content: Gautam Gambhir, the current Team India head coach, has firmly stated that there should be no relationship with Pakistan, especially in cricket and entertainment, following the Pahalgam terror attack. He emphasized that the nation's people and soldiers are more important.

title: Random Musings: How Kash Patel broke every stereotype about Indian-Americans
content: For decades, Indian-American success stories followed a predictable script: study hard, stay quiet, become a doctor, maybe build an app, and always say thank you. Kash Patel took that script, lit it on fire, and walked into the FBI wearing sunglasses and sacred threads ‚Äî chanting ‚ÄúJai Shree Krishna‚Äù while rewriting the rules of power in Washington.

title: Gautam Gambhir: 'Hindustan ki cricket kisi ki jagir nahi hai'
content: Gautam Gambhir, at the ABP India At 2047 Summit, strongly responded to criticism surrounding his coaching. He asserted his focus is on national pride, not pleasing commentators, and criticized former players treating Indian cricket as their domain. Gambhir defended his past actions and emphasized his commitment to building a fearless team, prioritizing accountability and nationalism over personal gain.

title: 'PM Modi had intel': Kharge's big claim on Pahalgam attack; BJP hits back
content: Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge accused Prime Minister Narendra Modi of withholding intelligence about the impending terrorist attack in Pahalgam, Jammu and Kashmir. Kharge linked the postponement of PM Modi's Srinagar visit to the attack, questioning why the intelligence wasn't shared with security forces. He criticized the government for alleged intelligence failure and inadequate security for tourists following the attack.

title: Paul Skenes‚Äô wife Livvy Dunne responds to viral backlash with grace
content: Livvy Dunne's "Riders Up" rallying call didn't exactly go according to plan, but she took the online criticism with a calm and sense of humor. Instead of overreacting, she went low-key and remained herself. As she sets off on life post-gymnastics, one thing is certain: Livvy Dunne‚Äôs star power won't be extinguished.

title: After Pak YouTubers ban, Cong leaders making content for them: Shehzad Poonawalla
content: BJP's Shehzad Poonawalla accuses Congress leaders of acting as "content creators for Pakistan" amid heightened tensions following the Pahalgam massacre. He criticizes Charanjit Singh Channi's questioning of the surgical strike and Ajay Rai's mocking of the Rafale jets. Poonawalla's remarks come after Congress leaders questioned intelligence on terror activity in Kashmir, further fueling the political clash.

title: India, UK sign Free Trade Agreement; PM Modi terms it 'historic milestone'
content: India and the United Kingdom have finalized a Free Trade Agreement (FTA) and a Double Contribution Convention, marking a significant advancement in their strategic alliance. Prime Minister Modi announced the agreement after discussions with UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer, highlighting its potential to boost trade, investment, and job creation.

title: Shubman Gill reveals why Kagiso Rabada isn‚Äôt playing against MI
content: Shubman Gill revealed Kagiso Rabada's absence from Gujarat Titans' crucial match against Mumbai Indians, citing the need for him to regain rhythm. Gujarat, opting to field after winning the toss, brought in Arshad Khan for Washington Sundar. Mumbai Indians, with six consecutive wins, pose a significant threat in the intensifying playoff race, making this clash vital for both teams.

title: Is Anthony Edwards really bald now? Viral image sends NBA fans into frenzy
content: A digitally altered photo of Anthony Edwards sporting a bald head, reminiscent of Michael Jordan, went viral, sparking humorous reactions and comparisons online. The image, shared by a parody account, fooled many despite the account's satirical nature. While Edwards retains his usual hairstyle, the edited image fueled playful speculation and memes among NBA fans.

title: Gautam Gambhir breaks silence on 'rift' with Rohit Sharma
content: Gautam Gambhir has dismissed rumours of a rift with Rohit Sharma, emphasizing their mutual respect and professionalism. He highlighted their recent Champions Trophy win, questioning the basis for such speculation. Gambhir also addressed his rapport with Virat Kohli, downplaying any perceived issues and reaffirming a strong working dynamic within the Indian cricket team.

title: 'Rioters are being brought to Bengal': Mamata Banerjee in Murshidabad
content: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee accused external elements of instigating violence in the state, urging people to resist divisive agendas promoted by the BJP and religious fundamentalists. Speaking in Murshidabad, she asserted that the Waqf Act would not be implemented in Bengal, appealing for calm amidst potential protests.

title: Gautam Gambhir explains what went wrong for India in BGT
content: Gautam Gambhir believes India narrowly missed a historic Test series win against Australia due to a lack of bowling depth. Addressing speculation about his relationship with Virat Kohli, he dismissed it as playful banter between two Delhi natives. Gambhir emphasized his commitment to Indian cricket, stating his current role is a greater responsibility than his previous franchise position.

title: Germany in turmoil as Merz fails in chancellor bid: What happens next?
content: Friedrich Merz failed to secure an outright majority in the Bundestag, prompting the AfD to demand new elections and criticize the government's leadership. The unprecedented outcome exposed divisions within the coalition, raising doubts about Merz's ability to govern effectively. Despite the setback, analysts believe Merz may still become chancellor, but the vote has weakened his position amid global instability.

title: Slaps, screams & smashed phones: School principal, librarian clash on cam
content: A school in Madhya Pradesh witnessed a violent clash between the principal and librarian over division of duties, escalating into physical assault with slapping, hair-pulling, and phone smashing. The viral video prompted immediate action, leading to the removal of both women from their positions pending a departmental inquiry and potential police action.

title: Why Gautam Gambhir said Virat Kohli's fitness is unmatched in Indian cricket
content: Gautam Gambhir lauded Virat Kohli's exceptional fitness, humorously expressing his desire to possess Kohli's physical prowess. Addressing past IPL rivalries, Gambhir dismissed tensions as playful banter between Delhi natives. He acknowledged India's near-miss in the Australia Test series and affirmed his commitment to elevating Indian cricket, prioritizing performance and discipline.

title: SC: Trend of ED making allegations against accused without evidence
content: The Supreme Court has raised concerns about the Enforcement Directorate (ED) making unsubstantiated allegations in money laundering cases, highlighting a pattern of lacking evidence to link accused individuals to proceeds of crime. This observation arose during a bail hearing for an accused in the Chhattisgarh liquor scam, where the court questioned the ED's evidence linking the accused to a specific amount of illicit funds.

title: Gautam Gambhir breaks silence on Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's future
content: Gautam Gambhir, the new Indian cricket team head coach, has made it clear that Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's future hinges solely on performance. He emphasized that delivering results is paramount for selection, dismissing any notions of farewells based on legacy. Gambhir also addressed media speculation about his relationship with Kohli, downplaying it as playful banter between two Delhi natives.

title: Adani Power wins 1,500 MW electricity supply contract for UP
content: Adani Power has secured a 25-year contract to supply 1,500 MW of electricity to Uttar Pradesh at Rs 5.383 per unit. The power will be generated from a new 1,600 MW thermal power project within the state. Uttar Pradesh cabinet approved the procurement to meet the projected additional demand of 10,795 MW by 2033-34.

title: Meet 'Champak': IPL's viral robot dog that redefining broadcast innovation
content: The Indian Premier League introduced 'Champak,' a robot dog, to enhance the broadcast experience. Developed by wTVision in partnership with Omnicam and the BCCI, this four-legged robot interacts with players and spectators. Despite logistical challenges, including dismantling and reassembling for each match, Champak has garnered significant social media attention, becoming a viral sensation.

title: Virat Kohli reveals the biggest heartbreak of his captaincy
content: Virat Kohli has opened up about the profound disappointment he felt after India's 2019 World Cup semifinal loss to New Zealand. Speaking on the RCB Podcast, Kohli described feeling "dazed" and directionless in the aftermath of the defeat. Despite a strong showing in the league stage, India's hopes were dashed by a batting collapse and Dhoni's late run-out.

title: 'Virat Kohli is 'Mr safety' for RCB'
content: AB de Villiers has defended Virat Kohli against criticism regarding his strike rate in the IPL, highlighting Kohli's consistent performance and crucial role for RCB. De Villiers reminded critics of past comments about Kohli's slow batting, pointing to his recent high strike rate as evidence to the contrary. He emphasized Kohli's reliability and importance to the team's success.

title: Rules for Cubbon Park: Government Order specifies what‚Äôs allowed and what‚Äôs prohibited
content: From a cap on the number of people who can gather for an event to a ban on consumption of food and certain toys, the guidelines have covered several aspects

title: The tale of¬†Bharatha Matha temple, a pet project of¬†C.R.¬†Das¬†and¬†Subramania¬†Siva
content:
Congress stalwarts C.R.¬†Das¬†and¬†Subramania¬†Siva initiated the¬†
Bharatha Matha¬†temple at¬†Paparapatti¬†in¬†Dharmapuri.¬†After Siva died, it went out of public discourse. In June 2018, Chief Minister¬†
Edappadi K.¬†Palaniswami of the¬†AIADMK¬†announced that the temple would be built at an estimated cost of ‚Çπ1.5¬†crore. It was declared open in August 2021

title: Government bans Indian satellite internet terminals from working outside India
content: The Department of Telecommunications issued a series of additional guidelines to satellite internet services, even as SpaceX‚Äôs Starlink continues to await the greenlight to offer its services in India.

title: Namma Metro introduces QR code ticket-vending machines at Byappanahalli station
content: The move follows the successful pilot launch of similar machines at M.G. Road and Cubbon Park stations on the Purple Line

title: BJP demands unconditional apology from Congress, calls Kharge‚Äôs remarks ‚Äòirresponsible‚Äô
content: Party accuses Congress of weakening national security and aligning with anti-India narratives following remarks on Kashmir visit

title: Implement pre-exposure prophylaxis programme in State to prevent rabies death: KGMOA
content: If a person who has taken PrEP vaccine sustains animal bite, they nned to take only two booster shots

title: BBMP chief inspects footpaths in Bengaluru, issues slew of directions
content: Maheshwar Rao instructs officials to prioritise pedestrian infrastructure, remove encroachments, and widen the footpath at Shantala Silk Junction using the space available inside the bus stand

title: Population-based delimitation is fair, says BJP ally Upendra Kushwaha
content: Southern States were ‚Äòdenying the rights‚Äô of other States, the Rashtriya Lok Morcha chief said it was the right of citizens in the Hindi-speaking States to be allocated Lok Sabha seats according to their numbers

title: To check fake news, government rethinks safe harbour for online platforms
content: Intermediary platforms such as YouTube, Facebook, Instagram and X currently enjoy a safe harbour under Section 79 of Information Technology Act 2000

title: Financial impropriety forced Modi govt. to remove Subramanian as IMF executive director: Congress
content: Congress spokesperson Supriya Shrinate alleged that Union Bank of India placed an order for two lakh copies of a book authored by Subramanian, who had earlier served as Chief Economic Adviser to the Union government

title: Dhinakaran criticises DMK govt. for not fulfilling poll promises
content: He say the ‚Äòsingular achievement‚Äô of the DMK government is to rake up issues with a view to deflect ‚Äúdissatisfaction‚Äù of the public with the performance of the government

title: Supreme Court details 221 names approved by the Chandrachud and Khanna Collegiums
content: Only half of recommended names cleared; data reveals low representation from SC, ST, and OBC communities in HC appointments

title: Kerala firm weaves its magic at Met Gala
content: The striking blue carpet sprinkled with yellow and white daffodils that graced the fashion‚Äôs most dazzling event had its origins at Cherthala

title: India well-placed to conduct caste census, says Prof. Sukhdeo Thorat
content: Expert suggests careful preparation, learning from past efforts; calls for data on caste discrimination and sub-categorisation

title: Kerala to go global with Apple TV series
content: The series is a celebration of Kerala‚Äôs evolving narrative as a prime tourism destination and will help Kerala Tourism‚Äôs novel campaigns

title: ‚Çπ25 lakh ex gratia handed over to kin of Simhachalam wall collapse victims
content: Patti Durga Swamy Naidu, 33, and K.M.E. Sesha Rao, 26, natives of Machavaram village in Ambajipeta Mandal in Dr. B.R. Ambedkar Konaseema District were killed in the wall collapse

title: Digital luggage locker facility at Thiruvananthapuram Central railway station
content: SafeCloak is a self-operable, digital luggage storage solution that allows passengers to securely store their bags for a desired duration

title: Samastha seeks revocation of Asgar Ali Faizy‚Äôs expulsion from Arabic college
content: Faizy, a veteran scholar and senior Mushawara member, was expelled from Jamia Nooriyya Arabic College in March reportedly in retaliation for his veiled criticism against Indian Union Muslim League (IUML) State president Sadikali Shihab Thangal

title: Tirupati‚Äôs annual folk festival begins at Sri Tataiahgunta Gangamma temple
content: Priests tied ‚ÄòVadibalu‚Äô to the stone pillar located in front of the temple to announce the commencement of the festival

title: Stone laid for ‚Çπ12.72 crore Flatted Factory Complex in Srikalahasti
content: The project will be developed on 1.04 acres of land and will include 30 industrial units, with designated space for banks, storage and administrative facilities

title: Life expectancy in India rose from 58.6 years in 1990 to 72 years in 2023: UNDP‚Äôs HDI¬†report
content: India‚Äôs ranking on the Human Development Index improved from 133 in 2022 to 130 in 2023; the report highlights the critical role of AI in shaping the next chapter of human development, particularly in fast-growing economies, including India

title: Thrissur Pooram: A dazzling tapestry of tradition and revelry
content: Unique in its grandeur, rituals, and celebrations, Thrissur Pooram draws thousands of devotees and spectators from around the world. It is a fascinating fusion of sacred ceremonies, traditional performances, dazzling fireworks, and majestic elephant parades

title: India-U.K. free trade agreements highlights
content: India ensures that non-tariff barriers are suitably addressed to ensure free flow of goods and services and that they do not create unjustified restrictions to its exports.

title: TTD convenes an emergency meeting on April 7
content: The meeting is being convened urgently at the direction of the government to deliberate on key issues that demand an immediate resolution

title: Post Pahalgam attack, Gondola rides in Gulmarg plummet
content: Over 40,000 cancellations in two weeks have resulted in the loss of around ‚Çπ15 crore to Jammu and Kashmir Cable Car Corporation so far

title: Government faces dilemma as aided colleges pursue deemed university status
content: Government recently passed a landmark Bill that envisions encouraging reputed college managements to establish private universities.  The present development could prompt more institutions to seek the deemed status, as it offers more operational flexibility than the private university framework under the State legislation. Notably, deemed universities can function as a cluster of institutions, while private universities will not be permitted to establish multiple campuses in the State

title: Kudumbashree premium cafe opens at Panmana
content: Signature dish of the cafe is special Desinganadu meen sadya (fish feast) featuring four types of fish, prawns, and crab

title: The secret to success is patience, perseverance and confidence, students told
content: Superintendent of Police Laxman Nimbargi addresses The Hindu EducationPlus Career Counselling 2025 in Vijayapura

title: Toothukudi Collector issues guidelines to ensure children‚Äôs safety; all school vehicles to have a woman assistant
content: District Collector inspects vehicles during annual audit safety; in his advisory, he says strangers should be allowed to enter school vehicles

title: Chittoor should achieve top position in welfare schemes, says in-charge Minister
content: Ramprasad Reddy asks the District Water Management Agency officials to take steps for improving the groundwater levels in the district

title: Late-night arrest of YouTuber sparks controversy
content: BJP portrays Shajan Skaria‚Äôs arrest as a violation of fundamental rights and bid to stifle democratic dissent

title: Mule deaths on Kedarnath trek prompt government inquiry
content: State suspends mule services for Yatra after 14 deaths in first three days; expert team to investigate cause

title: Returning the Bundesliga crown to Bayern is a job well done for Kompany
content: germany's most successful club tasting success as Sofa-Meister (couch champions) celebrated as a group on Sunday at the K√§fer restaurant in desirable Bogenhausen . on Saturday, the party proper will commence in front of 75,000 at the allianz Arena against Borussia Monchengladbach .

title: Waiver wire: Why settle for one rising star when you can have two?
content: a pair of young hitters who put on power displays over the weekend are among the top fantasy baseball pickups . they're beginning to flourish at the big-league level, albeit for different teams . the 2025 fantasy baseball season is here, or start a brand new tradition .

title: This time at UCF, Scott Frost won't need to catch lightning in a bottle
content: Scott Frost is reuniting with the UCF Knights as their new head coach . the Knights are now in a power 4 conference, and there is now a 12-team college football playoff . he is a new coach at the university of central Florida .

title: Things got 'awkward': Jim Knowles opens up about move from Ohio State to Penn State
content: Ohio State defensive coordinator Jim Knowles opted to leave for Penn State . Knowles is widely regarded as one of the top defensive coordinators in the country . his defense last year ranked No. 1 in points allowed per game, yards allow per game .

title: Previewing Capitals-Canes, Knights-Oilers
content: the two teams went 2-2 in their regular-season series in 2024-25, with the Canes outscoring the Caps 14-10 on aggregate . the game pits the Carolina Hurricanes against the Washington Capitals ( 7 p.m. ET, ESPN ).

title: Grand Theft Auto VI releases information on main characters
content: a new trailer for the game has been released, showcasing the two main characters . the duo is described as wanting "an easy life" that somehow keeps avoiding him . "Meeting Lucia could be the best or worst thing to ever happen to him," the description says .

title: NBA conference semifinals: Late surge gives Nuggets 1-0 lead over OKC
content: no. 4 seed Indiana Pacers beat the no. 1 seed Cleveland Cavaliers 121-112 in the Eastern and Western conference semifinals . on monday, the Northeast's third-seeded New York Knicks beat the 2-seed Boston Celtics in an overtime thriller in Game 1 behind Jalen Brunson .

title: Ranking the top 10 players of the playoffs
content: a handful of names have just barely missed the cut, at least one or two of whom might be a surprise . the top contenders for the 2024-25 MVP award, Nikola Jokic and Shai Gilgeous-Alexander, will line up across from one another .

title: Power 4 coaches on the NFL draft: Intel on Shedeur Sanders' slide, sleeper picks and six schools' classes
content: the draft kicks off just as college football's spring transfer portal window was set to close . college coaches were focused on the final few pieces of their rosters for the 2025 season . the transfer portal itself is also a factor, as the increased movement of players exposes them to more coaches .

title: The most astounding numbers of Aaron Judge's torrid start to 2025
content: Aaron Judge is hitting an astounding .423/.510/.777 with 10 extra-base hits during his eighth-inning double Sunday . he leads the majors in batting average, on-base percentage, slugging percentage, OPS and hits .

title: 'American-Israeli aggression': Houthi rebels say Sanaa airport hit

title: NBA playoff odds: Big changes after Game 1 wins by Knicks, Nuggets
content: the defending champion Boston Celtics squandered a big lead against the new york Knicks . the Cleveland Cavaliers look to even the series against the Indiana Pacers . Golden State Warriors and Minnesota Timberwolves play Game 1 in Minnesota .

title: College baseball Week 12: Top 25 rankings and what to watch
content: Coastal Carolina jumped up five spots, making room for the USC Trojans to be ranked for the first time tuesday . wehiwa aloy and Kuhio Aloy are among the best players on the team's roster . cnn's david mccarthy takes a look back at some of the best plays from u.s. players .
